introduction: I was born in Walla Walla, Washington in 1998. I grew up in a family of nine siblings, including myself. I have four brothers and four sisters and am the third youngest in my family. I met my wife in Walla Walla, Washington when she moved in, right before I left for a two-year mission for The Church of Jesus Christ. After high school I went on a mission to Fort Worth, Texas serving and teaching the people there. When I got home from serving, I got married to my wife Emily after dating for a few months. I went to college at BYU-Idaho to get my bachelor’s degree in Software Engineering with an emphasis in web development. I tried out a few other majors but found that I have a passion for Web Development. I love doing it and creating something out of code like a puzzle, to see the bigger picture when it all comes together. I love how web development allows me to always be learning new skills to become even better at what I enjoy doing for myself and for others.

interest.name: Movies
interest.description: These are some of the following favorite movies I like, as follows:

titles.name: How to Train Your Dragon
titles.summary: I first fell in love with this movie because I like fantasy and I always thought dragons, and especially the idea of riding and flying with them, sounded cool. I grew to like the movie more with each new one that came out. I saw the characters develop and remind me of my own relationships and life journey. I think it has a great message of courage, leadership, and compassion. This movie was made in 2010 and was based on a book about Hiccup who is an awkward guy who trains to fight dragons but ends up befriending one and learns how to ride him. Together they convince the whole village that dragons are not their enemies, but rather, they can be the best of friends.

interest.name: Board Games
interest.description: I have found board games to be one of my favorite things to do with others. Here are some of my favorite Board games, as follows:

titles.name: Scythe
titles.summary: This was a game I was first introduced to by my brothers. We love to play games together especially strategic games that involve conquering or competition. I have now learned the game well and have taught my wife how to play. We have played together a few times now, but it is a longer game that requires a lot of thought, so we haven’t really played it since having a baby. In Scythe, each player represents a leader attempting to restore their honor and lead their faction to power. Players conquer territory, enlist new recruits, reap resources, gain villagers, build structures, and activate powerful mechs. I love that there are many ways to win and how it plays out differently each time.
